ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] OT: Buyer Beware! "copy protected CDs".
ygData.msgSnippet: Yeah. And I smell a lawsuit coming from Mac owners. As my history teacher said You can always sue . He would say you wouldn t necessarily win, but you could
ygData.messageBody:
Yeah. And I smell a lawsuit coming from Mac owners. As my history teacher
said "You can always sue". He would say you wouldn't necessarily win, but
you could try.
luv,
-Su

I've seen that...it damages the Open Firmware on a lot of newer Macs.
Charming, huh?
----- Original Message -----
From: Su
To: LHML@yahoogroups.com ; nlml@yahoogroups.com ;
robintheboywonder@yahoogroups.com ; EverQuest@yahoogroups.com ;
Spellbinders@yahoogroups.com ; BLUDHAVEN@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, June 05, 2002 12:23 PM
Subject: [EverQuest] OT: Buyer Beware! "copy protected CDs".


A friend just passed this info along and I felt strongly enough about it
to
pass it along to everyone because I detest anything that crashes computers
and wanted to make everyone aware of this new stupidity.
http://uk.eurorights.org/issues/cd/docs/celdion.shtml

Basically, the "CD"s listed will not only not play, but they can crash
your
computer and cause damage. I understand that record companies don't want
songs being ripped, but the only CD player I use is in my computer. Some
companies just amaze me with their stupidity. Their form of copy
protection
is just not the way to go.
At least Philips is taking the more consumer friendly approach.
http://news.com.com/2100-1023-817937.html

Anyways, just wanted to share.
luv,
-Su
